segment.source: Introduction to configuration service providers (CSPs) for IT pros (Windows 10)
segment.target: Introduction to configuration service providers (CSPs) for IT pros (Windows 10)

segment.source: Configuration service providers (CSPs) expose device configuration settings in Windows 10.
segment.target: Configuration service providers (CSPs) expose device configuration settings in Windows 10.

segment.source: Introduction to configuration service providers (CSPs) for IT pros
segment.target: Introduction to configuration service providers (CSPs) for IT pros

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Configuration service providers (CSPs) expose device configuration settings in Windows 10.
segment.target: Configuration service providers (CSPs) expose device configuration settings in Windows 10.

segment.source: This topic is written for people who have no experience with CSPs.
segment.target: This topic is written for people who have no experience with CSPs.

segment.source: The CSPs are documented on the Hardware Dev Center because CSPs are used by mobile device management (MDM) service providers.
segment.target: The CSPs are documented on the Hardware Dev Center because CSPs are used by mobile device management (MDM) service providers.

segment.source: This topic explains how IT pros and system administrators can take advantage of many settings available through CSPs to configure devices running Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile in their organizations.
segment.target: This topic explains how IT pros and system administrators can take advantage of many settings available through CSPs to configure devices running Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile in their organizations.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The explanation of CSPs and CSP documentation also apply to Windows Mobile 5, Windows Mobile 6, Windows Phone 7, and Windows Phone 8, but links to current CSPs are for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: The explanation of CSPs and CSP documentation also apply to Windows Mobile 5, Windows Mobile 6, Windows Phone 7, and Windows Phone 8, but links to current CSPs are for Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: What is a CSP?
segment.target: What is a CSP?

segment.source: A CSP is an interface in the client operating system between configuration settings specified in a provisioning document and configuration settings on the device.
segment.target: A CSP is an interface in the client operating system between configuration settings specified in a provisioning document and configuration settings on the device.

segment.source: Their function is similar to that of Group Policy client-side extensions in that they provide an interface to read, set, modify, or delete configuration settings for a given feature.
segment.target: Their function is similar to that of Group Policy client-side extensions in that they provide an interface to read, set, modify, or delete configuration settings for a given feature.

segment.source: Typically, these settings map to registry keys, files or permissions.
segment.target: Typically, these settings map to registry keys, files or permissions.

segment.source: Some of these settings are configurable and some are read-only.
segment.target: Some of these settings are configurable and some are read-only.

segment.source: Starting in Windows Mobile 5.0, CSPs were used to manage Windows mobile devices.
segment.target: Starting in Windows Mobile 5.0, CSPs were used to manage Windows mobile devices.

segment.source: In the Windows 10 platform, the management approach for both desktop and mobile devices converges, taking advantage of the same CSPs to configure and manage all devices running Windows 10.
segment.target: In the Windows 10 platform, the management approach for both desktop and mobile devices converges, taking advantage of the same CSPs to configure and manage all devices running Windows 10.

segment.source: Each CSP provides access to specific settings.
segment.target: Each CSP provides access to specific settings.

segment.source: For example, the Wi-Fi CSP contains the settings to create a Wi-Fi profile.
segment.target: For example, the Wi-Fi CSP contains the settings to create a Wi-Fi profile.

segment.source: CSPs are behind many of the management tasks and policies for Windows 10 in Microsoft Intune and non-Microsoft MDM service providers.
segment.target: CSPs are behind many of the management tasks and policies for Windows 10 in Microsoft Intune and non-Microsoft MDM service providers.

segment.source: For example, in Intune, the policy to allow search suggestions in the Microsoft Edge address bar uses Browser/AllowSearchSuggestionsinAddressBar in the Policy CSP.
segment.target: For example, in Intune, the policy to allow search suggestions in the Microsoft Edge address bar uses Browser/AllowSearchSuggestionsinAddressBar in the Policy CSP.

segment.source: how intune maps to csp
segment.target: how intune maps to csp

segment.source: CSPs receive configuration policies in the XML-based SyncML format pushed to it from an MDM-compliant management server such as Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: CSPs receive configuration policies in the XML-based SyncML format pushed to it from an MDM-compliant management server such as Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Traditional enterprise management systems, such as System Center Configuration Manager, can also target CSPs by using a client-side WMI-to-CSP bridge.
segment.target: Traditional enterprise management systems, such as System Center Configuration Manager, can also target CSPs by using a client-side WMI-to-CSP bridge.

segment.source: Synchronization Markup Language (SyncML)
segment.target: Synchronization Markup Language (SyncML)

segment.source: The Open Mobile Alliance Device Management (OMA-DM) protocol uses the XML-based Synchronization Markup Language (SyncML) for data exchange between compliant servers and clients.
segment.target: The Open Mobile Alliance Device Management (OMA-DM) protocol uses the XML-based Synchronization Markup Language (SyncML) for data exchange between compliant servers and clients.

segment.source: SyncML offers an open standard to use as an alternative to vendor-specific management solutions (such as WMI).
segment.target: SyncML offers an open standard to use as an alternative to vendor-specific management solutions (such as WMI).

segment.source: The value for enterprises adopting industry standard management protocols is that it allows the management of a broader set of vendor devices using a single platform (such as Microsoft Intune).
segment.target: The value for enterprises adopting industry standard management protocols is that it allows the management of a broader set of vendor devices using a single platform (such as Microsoft Intune).

segment.source: Device policies, including VPN connection profiles, are delivered to client devices formatted as in SyncML.
segment.target: Device policies, including VPN connection profiles, are delivered to client devices formatted as in SyncML.

segment.source: The target CSP reads this information and applies the necessary configurations.
segment.target: The target CSP reads this information and applies the necessary configurations.

segment.source: The WMI-to-CSP Bridge
segment.target: The WMI-to-CSP Bridge

segment.source: The WMI-to-CSP Bridge is a component allowing configuration of Windows 10 CSPs via scripts and traditional enterprise management software such as Configuration Manager using Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI).
segment.target: The WMI-to-CSP Bridge is a component allowing configuration of Windows 10 CSPs via scripts and traditional enterprise management software such as Configuration Manager using Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI).

segment.source: The bridge is responsible for reading WMI commands and through a component called the common device configurator pass them to a CSP for application on the device.
segment.target: The bridge is responsible for reading WMI commands and through a component called the common device configurator pass them to a CSP for application on the device.

segment.source: Learn how to use the WMI Bridge Provider with PowerShell.
segment.target: Learn how to use the WMI Bridge Provider with PowerShell.

segment.source: Why should you learn about CSPs?
segment.target: Why should you learn about CSPs?

segment.source: Generally, enterprises rely on Group Policy or MDM to configure and manage devices.
segment.target: Generally, enterprises rely on Group Policy or MDM to configure and manage devices.

segment.source: For devices running Windows, MDM services use CSPs to configure your devices.
segment.target: For devices running Windows, MDM services use CSPs to configure your devices.

segment.source: In addition, you may have unmanaged devices, or a large number of devices that you want to configure before enrolling them in management, or you want to apply custom settings that aren't available through your MDM service.
segment.target: In addition, you may have unmanaged devices, or a large number of devices that you want to configure before enrolling them in management, or you want to apply custom settings that aren't available through your MDM service.

segment.source: The CSP documentation can help you understand the settings that can be configured or queried.
segment.target: The CSP documentation can help you understand the settings that can be configured or queried.

segment.source: In addition, some of the topics in the Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile library on Technet include links to applicable CSP reference topics, such as Cortana integration in your business or enterprise which links to the Policy CSP.
segment.target: In addition, some of the topics in the Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile library on Technet include links to applicable CSP reference topics, such as Cortana integration in your business or enterprise which links to the Policy CSP.

segment.source: In the CSP topics, you can learn about all of the available configuration settings.
segment.target: In the CSP topics, you can learn about all of the available configuration settings.

segment.source: CSPs in Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD)
segment.target: CSPs in Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD)

segment.source: You can use Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) to create provisioning packages to apply settings to devices during the out-of-box-experience (OOBE) and after devices are set up.
segment.target: You can use Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) to create provisioning packages to apply settings to devices during the out-of-box-experience (OOBE) and after devices are set up.

segment.source: You can use provisioning packages to configure a device's connectivity and enroll the device in MDM.
segment.target: You can use provisioning packages to configure a device's connectivity and enroll the device in MDM.

segment.source: Many of the runtime settings in Windows ICD are based on CSPs.
segment.target: Many of the runtime settings in Windows ICD are based on CSPs.

segment.source: Many settings in Windows ICD will display documentation for that setting in the center pane, and will include a reference to the CSP if the setting uses one, as shown in the following image.
segment.target: Many settings in Windows ICD will display documentation for that setting in the center pane, and will include a reference to the CSP if the setting uses one, as shown in the following image.

segment.source: how help content appears in icd
segment.target: how help content appears in icd

segment.source: Configure devices without MDM explains how to use the Windows ICD tool included in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10 to create a runtime provisioning package.
segment.target: Configure devices without MDM explains how to use the Windows ICD tool included in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10 to create a runtime provisioning package.

segment.source: CSPs in MDM
segment.target: CSPs in MDM

segment.source: Most, if not all, CSPs are surfaced through your MDM service.
segment.target: Most, if not all, CSPs are surfaced through your MDM service.

segment.source: If you see a CSP that provides a capability that you want to make use of and cannot find that capability in your MDM service, contact your MDM provider for assistance.
segment.target: If you see a CSP that provides a capability that you want to make use of and cannot find that capability in your MDM service, contact your MDM provider for assistance.

segment.source: It might simply be named differently than you expected.
segment.target: It might simply be named differently than you expected.

segment.source: You can see the CSPs supported by MDM in the Configuration service provider reference.
segment.target: You can see the CSPs supported by MDM in the Configuration service provider reference.

segment.source: When a CSP is available but is not explicitly included in your MDM solution, you may be able to make use of the CSP by using OMA-URI settings.
segment.target: When a CSP is available but is not explicitly included in your MDM solution, you may be able to make use of the CSP by using OMA-URI settings.

segment.source: In Intune, for example, you can use custom policy settings to deploy settings.
segment.target: In Intune, for example, you can use custom policy settings to deploy settings.

segment.source: Intune documents a partial list of settings that you can enter in the OMA-URI Settings section of a custom policy, if your MDM service provides that extension.
segment.target: Intune documents a partial list of settings that you can enter in the OMA-URI Settings section of a custom policy, if your MDM service provides that extension.

segment.source: You'll notice that the list doesn't explain the meanings of the allowed and default values, so use the CSP reference documentation to locate that information.
segment.target: You'll notice that the list doesn't explain the meanings of the allowed and default values, so use the CSP reference documentation to locate that information.

segment.source: CSPs in Lockdown XML
segment.target: CSPs in Lockdown XML

segment.source: Lockdown XML can be used to configure devices running Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: Lockdown XML can be used to configure devices running Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: You can manually author a Lockdown XML file to make use of the configuration settings available through the EnterpriseAssignedAccess configuration service provider (CSP).
segment.target: You can manually author a Lockdown XML file to make use of the configuration settings available through the EnterpriseAssignedAccess configuration service provider (CSP).

segment.source: How do you use the CSP documentation?
segment.target: How do you use the CSP documentation?

segment.source: All CSPs in Windows 10 are documented in the Configuration service provider reference.
segment.target: All CSPs in Windows 10 are documented in the Configuration service provider reference.

segment.source: The main CSP topic tells you which CSPs are supported on each edition of Windows 10, and links to the documentation for each individual CSP.
segment.target: The main CSP topic tells you which CSPs are supported on each edition of Windows 10, and links to the documentation for each individual CSP.

segment.source: csp per windows edition
segment.target: csp per windows edition

segment.source: The documentation for each CSP follows the same structure.
segment.target: The documentation for each CSP follows the same structure.

segment.source: After an introduction that explains the purpose of the CSP, a diagram shows the parts of the CSP in tree format.
segment.target: After an introduction that explains the purpose of the CSP, a diagram shows the parts of the CSP in tree format.

segment.source: The full path to a specific configuration setting is represented by its Open Mobile Alliance - Uniform Resource Identifier (OMA-URI).
segment.target: The full path to a specific configuration setting is represented by its Open Mobile Alliance - Uniform Resource Identifier (OMA-URI).

segment.source: The URI is relative to the devices’ root node (MSFT, for example).
segment.target: The URI is relative to the devices’ root node (MSFT, for example).

segment.source: Features supported by a particular CSP can be set by addressing the complete OMA-URI path.
segment.target: Features supported by a particular CSP can be set by addressing the complete OMA-URI path.

segment.source: The following example shows the diagram for the AssignedAccess CSP.
segment.target: The following example shows the diagram for the AssignedAccess CSP.

segment.source: The diagram maps to the XML for that CSP.
segment.target: The diagram maps to the XML for that CSP.

segment.source: Notice the different shapes in the diagram: rounded elements are nodes and rectangular elements are settings or policies for which a value must be supplied.
segment.target: Notice the different shapes in the diagram: rounded elements are nodes and rectangular elements are settings or policies for which a value must be supplied.

segment.source: assigned access csp tree
segment.target: assigned access csp tree

segment.source: The element in the tree diagram after the root node tells you the name of the CSP.
segment.target: The element in the tree diagram after the root node tells you the name of the CSP.

segment.source: Knowing this structure, you would recognize in XML the parts of the URI path for that CSP and, if you saw it in XML, you would know which CSP reference to look up.
segment.target: Knowing this structure, you would recognize in XML the parts of the URI path for that CSP and, if you saw it in XML, you would know which CSP reference to look up.

segment.source: For example, in the following OMS-URI path for the kiosk mode app settings, you can see it uses the AssignedAccess CSP.
segment.target: For example, in the following OMS-URI path for the kiosk mode app settings, you can see it uses the AssignedAccess CSP.

segment.source: When an element in the diagram uses italic font, it indicates a placeholder for specific information, such as the tenant ID in the following example.
segment.target: When an element in the diagram uses italic font, it indicates a placeholder for specific information, such as the tenant ID in the following example.

segment.source: placeholder in csp tree
segment.target: placeholder in csp tree

segment.source: After the diagram, the documentation describes each element.
segment.target: After the diagram, the documentation describes each element.

segment.source: For each policy or setting, the valid values are listed.
segment.target: For each policy or setting, the valid values are listed.

segment.source: For example, in the AssignedAccess CSP, the setting is KioskModeApp.
segment.target: For example, in the AssignedAccess CSP, the setting is KioskModeApp.

segment.source: The documentation tells you that the value for KioskModeApp is a JSON string that contains the user account name and Application User Model ID (AUMID) of the Kiosk mode app.
segment.target: The documentation tells you that the value for KioskModeApp is a JSON string that contains the user account name and Application User Model ID (AUMID) of the Kiosk mode app.

segment.source: The documentation for most CSPs will also include an XML example.
segment.target: The documentation for most CSPs will also include an XML example.

segment.source: CSP examples
segment.target: CSP examples

segment.source: CSPs provide access to a number of settings useful to enterprises.
segment.target: CSPs provide access to a number of settings useful to enterprises.

segment.source: This section introduces two CSPs that an enterprise might find particularly useful.
segment.target: This section introduces two CSPs that an enterprise might find particularly useful.

segment.source: EnterpriseAssignedAccess CSP
segment.target: EnterpriseAssignedAccess CSP

segment.source: The EnterpriseAssignedAccess configuration service provider allows IT administrators to configure settings on a Windows 10 Mobile device.
segment.target: The EnterpriseAssignedAccess configuration service provider allows IT administrators to configure settings on a Windows 10 Mobile device.

segment.source: An enterprise can make use of this CSP to create single-use or limited-use mobile devices, such as a handheld device that only runs a price-checking app.
segment.target: An enterprise can make use of this CSP to create single-use or limited-use mobile devices, such as a handheld device that only runs a price-checking app.

segment.source: In addition to lockscreen wallpaper, theme, time zone, and language, the EnterpriseAssignedAccess CSP includes AssignedAccessXml which can be used to lock down the device through the following settings:
segment.target: In addition to lockscreen wallpaper, theme, time zone, and language, the EnterpriseAssignedAccess CSP includes AssignedAccessXml which can be used to lock down the device through the following settings:

segment.source: Enabling or disabling the Action Center.
segment.target: Enabling or disabling the Action Center.

segment.source: Configuring the number of tile columns in the Start layout.
segment.target: Configuring the number of tile columns in the Start layout.

segment.source: Restricting the apps that will be available on the device.
segment.target: Restricting the apps that will be available on the device.

segment.source: Restricting the settings that the user can access.
segment.target: Restricting the settings that the user can access.

segment.source: Restricting the hardware buttons that will be operable.
segment.target: Restricting the hardware buttons that will be operable.

segment.source: Restricting access to the context menu.
segment.target: Restricting access to the context menu.

segment.source: Enabling or disabling tile manipulation.
segment.target: Enabling or disabling tile manipulation.

segment.source: Creating role-specific configurations.
segment.target: Creating role-specific configurations.

segment.source: Policy CSP
segment.target: Policy CSP

segment.source: The Policy configuration service provider enables the enterprise to configure policies on Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: The Policy configuration service provider enables the enterprise to configure policies on Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: Some of these policy settings can also be applied using Group Policy, and the CSP documentation lists the equivalent Group Policy settings.
segment.target: Some of these policy settings can also be applied using Group Policy, and the CSP documentation lists the equivalent Group Policy settings.

segment.source: Some of the settings available in the Policy CSP include the following:
segment.target: Some of the settings available in the Policy CSP include the following:

segment.source: Accounts, such as whether a non-Microsoft account can be added to the device
segment.target: Accounts, such as whether a non-Microsoft account can be added to the device

segment.source: Application management, such as whether only Windows Store apps are allowed
segment.target: Application management, such as whether only Windows Store apps are allowed

segment.source: Bluetooth, such as the services allowed to use it
segment.target: Bluetooth, such as the services allowed to use it

segment.source: Browser, such as restricting InPrivate browsing
segment.target: Browser, such as restricting InPrivate browsing

segment.source: Connectivity, such as whether the device can be connected to a computer by USB
segment.target: Connectivity, such as whether the device can be connected to a computer by USB

segment.source: Defender (for desktop only), such as day and time to scan
segment.target: Defender (for desktop only), such as day and time to scan

segment.source: Device lock, such as the type of PIN or password required to unlock the device
segment.target: Device lock, such as the type of PIN or password required to unlock the device

segment.source: Experience, such as allowing Cortana
segment.target: Experience, such as allowing Cortana

segment.source: Security, such as whether provisioning packages are allowed
segment.target: Security, such as whether provisioning packages are allowed

segment.source: Settings, such as allowing the user to change VPN settings
segment.target: Settings, such as allowing the user to change VPN settings

segment.source: Start, such as applying a standard Start layout
segment.target: Start, such as applying a standard Start layout

segment.source: System, such as allowing the user to reset the device
segment.target: System, such as allowing the user to reset the device

segment.source: Text input, such as allowing the device to send anonymized user text input data samples to Microsoft
segment.target: Text input, such as allowing the device to send anonymized user text input data samples to Microsoft

segment.source: Update, such as specifying whether the device could use Microsoft Update, Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), or Windows Store
segment.target: Update, such as specifying whether the device could use Microsoft Update, Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), or Windows Store

segment.source: WiFi, such as whether to enable Internet sharing
segment.target: WiFi, such as whether to enable Internet sharing
